step1.sentence: She went through a very difficult period after her father passed away.

step2.story: Before the presentation, the team sat down to go through every slide one more time. They wanted to make sure there were no mistakes or missing information.

step3.story: When applying for a passport for the first time, Kevin had no idea how many steps were involved. He had to go through a long checklist of documents, visit two different offices, and wait for a background check. The whole process took nearly a month. But when the little blue booklet finally arrived in the mail, he held it up like a trophy.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 힘든 상황이나 경험을 겪다; 무언가를 꼼꼼히 살펴보다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 어려운 경험을 겪을 때, 또는 서류나 내용을 처음부터 끝까지 검토할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: go(이동하다)와 through(통과하여)가 결합하여 무언가를 처음부터 끝까지 통과한다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 경험으로 쓸 때는 주로 어렵거나 힘든 시간을 강조하고, 검토로 쓸 때는 철저히 살펴본다는 뉘앙스입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Let's go through the report together before we send it out.
